intro: Sarcoglottis umbrosa, commonly known as the shadowy sarcoglottis, is a tropical climbing plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant produces small, yellow-orange fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in shaded, humid environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
